issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.

This Kotlin extension function will be hidden by `java.util.SequencedCollection` starting in API 35: `removeFirst`. When this source code is recompiled against API level 35, it will crash on older levels. You can avoid this by using `removeAt(0)` instead.

issue.errorLine1: <string name="query_reset">Do you want to reset all heroes?</string>
<string name="query_restart_game">Do you want to reset all your current progress?</string>
<string name="choice_1">Yes, start a fresh game from the beginning.</string>

<string name="instr_7a">Chips need to cool down between operations. Hire heroes to reduce the chance of grouped attackers overwhelming a chip.\n\nIf you are stuck, you can replay a lower level trying to catch a running cryptocoin.</string>

<string name="instr_8">"
You can sell existing chips and re-use their slot. Most, but not all of the information will be refunded.

Note that an activated chip will complete its current cooldown cycle before disappearing."</string>

<string name="instr_9">"
Let´s introduce another chip. The MEM (for memory) chip takes a number and stores it safely away in memory. A little white indicator shows that there is a value inside.

The MEM chip must be “read out” (by tapping on it). Once you have tapped on the chip, its cool down cycle starts, and only after that the memory slot becomes available again. A thick white frame indicates whether you should tap on the chip.

For now, the MEM chip can hold only one attacker,. Later in the game you will be able to buy upgrades, creating additional slots.

MEM chips are powerful because they can take out any attacker, but they require your attention, and they are quite slow."</string>

<string name="instr_14">Another chip becomes available! 

The CLK (clock) chip does not affect the attackers itself. Instead, it speeds up the other chips on the board. Each time the CLK ticks, the cooldown timer of all other chips is reset, and they become ready to operate anew.

Upgrading increases the CLK frequency.</string>

<string name="instr_15">Overclocking the CPU can be dangerous: The faster your chips work, the hotter they will get.\n\nEach time your clock resets a chip, a small amount of heat is produced. Temperatures of more than %d degrees can damage the CPU, that means, that they can cost you one life.</string>
<string name="instr_16">The NOP chip (No operation) does nothing. But since it occupies a slot, you might want to remove it.\n\nA NOP 2 chip also does nothing, but twice.</string>

<string name="instr_17">Two more undesired chip types, then we have seen them all.

DUP duplicates an attacking piece of code. Instead of one attacker, you'll have two, with the same number.

SPLT (split) does nearly the same, but instead of simply duplicating the number, it splits it into two pieces. For example, xA4 becomes xA0 and x04. This is somewhat the opposite of ACC: If the two resulting numbers are combined by logical OR, you'll get the original values. </string>

<string name="instr_22">Remember that SHR chips are powerful but cannot eliminate attackers. They quickly reduce large values, but against hordes of weak attackers, multiple SUB chips may be a more cost-effective defence.</string>

<string name="instr_23">Not all electronic components are logic chips. There are also important classic, analogue components such as capacitors [C] or resistors [R]. 

In this game, resistors have the effect of slowing down the attackers for a certain period of time. Their strength is indicated by three coloured rings. The slowing effect is the bigger the stronger the attackers are. One-bit-numbers are hardly affected at all, whereas 8-bit numbers become quite slow by large resistances.

Resistors generate heat. There is a hero (Claude Shannon) who can convert some of this heat into information.</string>

<string name="instr_endless">You have successfully cleared all stages and won the game!

If you want, you can continue in “endless” mode, with randomly generated circuits that get more and more difficult. You will start the “endless” series without heroes, and you cannot use the coins gathered until now. 

How far will you get?</string>

<string name="turing">Alan Turing was one of the most important persons in computer science. He created many of the foundations in theoretical computing, such as the Turing machine and the Turing test, and made important breakthroughs in cryptology. Building on the work of the Polish Cipher Bureau, he led the team that was responsible for deciphering the Enigma code during the Second World War. His impact on the outcome of the war can hardly be overestimated.

He was heavily discriminated against because of his homosexuality. He died, probably by his own hand, in 1954.
</string>

<string name="knuth">"Donald Ervin Knuth is a computer scientist and mathematician who has made numerous contributions to theoretical computer science. He is mostly known for the monumental work “The Art of Computer Programming”, a project that started in 1962 and is still not finished. For this he created en passant the TeX formatting system that has become the standard for scientific publications all over the world."</string>

<string name="wiener">"Norbert Wiener is known as the founder of cybernetics, i.e. the control and regulation of machines, and is thus one of the pioneers of artificial intelligence. The term “cyber” coined by him is ubiquitous today. 

He developed mathematical theories, especially in the field of pattern recognition and image processing, and proved a number of mathematical theorems. 

Due to his experiences in WW2, he adopted an increasingly pacifist stance and refused to publish works that might cause harm in the hands of militarists."</string>

<string name="hopper">"\nGrace Brewster Murray Hopper had the idea that computer programs could be written in human-readable language instead of as sequences of Ones and Zeroes. She designed the FLOW-MATIC programming language, and thus invented the first compiler."</string>

<string name="mandelbrot">Benoît Mandelbrot was the most important founder of fractal geometry, which can not only be used to describe many structures in nature very well, but also to create fantastic graphics on the computer. \n\nThe graphical representation of the Mandelbrot set went viral and founded a new age of computer art.</string>

<string name="schneier">"Bruce Schneier is an expert on cryptography and information security. He has written important books on the subject, most notably “Applied Cryptography”, and has designed several cryptographic algorithms.\n \nHe is not afraid of criticizing governments or global companies if he deems their actions counterproductive to security or violating the right of privacy."</string>

<string name="meier">Sidney K. Meier has created some of the most influential strategy games and revolutionised the genre. With comparatively simple rules, his games simulate the complexities of reality amazingly well. And they always tell a story: of the age of the railways, of the American Revolution, or - as in his most famous work “Civilization” - of 6000 years of human history.</string>

<string name="kilby">Jack St. Clair Kilby had the idea of combining semiconductor elements - such as transistors or diodes - in an integrated circuit (IC) instead of wiring the components individually on a board. This was the basis for microchips and processors and made modern electronics with its miniaturisation possible in the first place.


Jack Kilby is also regarded as co-inventor of the pocket calculator and thermal printer.</string>

<string name="chappe">Together with his four brothers Ignace, Pierre François, René and Abraham, Claude Chappe developed the optical telegraph. His “tachygraph” was the first system with which information could be transmitted quickly over long distances, making it the forerunner of all modern communication. Around 1830, the Chappe semaphore system connected Paris with many important cities in France and Europe.</string>

<string name="hamilton">As a young programmer, Margaret Elaine Hamilton worked on military projects. In the mid-1960s she joined the Apollo moon landing project and quickly became head of software development. She and her team were responsible for programming and testing the guidance computer on board the spacecraft and lunar module, with the astronauts\' lives depending on the absolute reliability of the programmes.\n\nHamilton coined the term software engineering. And she is available as a Lego figure.</string>

<string name="leibniz">Like Pascal, Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz was also a great polymath of his time. We owe to him important advances in numerous very different fields of science, which are far too numerous to list here.\n\nHis achievement for the information age is the construction of complex mechanical calculating machines, which can be seen as the forerunners of modern computers. Above all, however, he recognised the importance of the dual system and the binary number code, which all digital devices use today.</string>

<string name="ohm">Georg Simon Ohm was one of the first to attempt to describe electrical processes mathematically. His work initially attracted little attention and was dismissed as an academic gimmick. It was not until Charles Wheatstone recognised their importance and asked Ada Lovelace to translate some of Ohm\'s works into English.\n\nToday, his name is inextricably linked with electrical resistance. Ohm\'s law and the unit of resistance are named after him.</string>

<string name="volta">Alessandro Giuseppe Antonio Anastasio Volta was an experimental physicist who questioned and refuted some of the theories and assumptions prevailing at the time. He not only discovered the gas methane, but also made groundbreaking discoveries in the new field of electricity. He described the relationship between voltage, charge and capacity. Above all, however, he developed the first functioning battery. \n\nThe unit of electrical voltage, the volt, is named after him.</string>

"This game is open source. Visit github.com/ochadenas/cpudefense for more information. The portraits of the Information Age Heroes are mostly derived from works of the public domain. Original photos: Alex Handy (CC BY-SA 2.0) Jacob Appelbaum (CC BY-SA 2.5) Konrad Jacobs (CC BY-SA 2.0 de) Rama (CC BY-SA 2.0 fr) Shervinafshar (CC BY-SA 3.0) Tony Bove (CC BY 3.0) Wolfgang Hunscher (CC BY-SA 3.0) Silvano de Gennaro (courtesy of the author) Clermont Auvergne Métropole (CC BY-SA 4.0) Jean-Frédéric (CC BY 2.0) Tekniska Museet (CC BY 2.0) The Royal Society (CC BY-SA 4.0) Konrad Jacobs (CC BY-SA 2.0 de) Computer boards: Autopilot (CC BY-SA 4.0) Bill Bertram (CC-BY 2.0) Oliver Chadenas (CC BY-SA 3.0) Smial (FAL) All other artwork: Oliver Chadenas (CC BY-SA 3.0)"
<string name="about_info_text">For additional info and hints on game play visit the game\'s wiki on the web.</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_CHIPSPEED">Decreases cooldown time of all %s chips</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_HEAT">Reduces the amount of generated heat</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_STARTINFO">Increases information at start of level</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_UPGRADECOST">Reduces upgrade cost of all chips</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_MAXHEROUPGRADE">Increases maximal upgrade level of other heroes</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_GAININFO">Increases information gain through destroying attackers</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_LIMITUNWANTED">Reduces the number of unwanted chips</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_DECREASEREMOVAL">Reduces the cost of unwanted chip removal</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_RES_DURATION">Increases the duration of resistance effect</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_CONVERT_HEAT">Converts some of the resistors\' heat into info</string>
<string name="HERO_EFFECT_CHANCE_DOUBLE">Gives %s chips a chance of double effect</string>
<string name="query_quit">Do you want to quit the current stage?</string>
<string name="ZZ_message_of_the_day">There have been major changes to game play, especially on the “Endless” levels. Check out the Release Notes in the INFO screen.</string>

<string name="ZZ_release_notes">Release Notes

Version 1.52
============
New Features:
- Stage numbers are optionally shown in hex (must be activated in Settings)

Bug fixes:
- When leaving the hero screen, the current hero is de-selected. Fixes issue #206.
- Coins in the hero screen are no longer shown separately if there are too many of them. Fixes issue #208.
- If an attacker becomes released from ACC or MEM during its fade-out animation, it no longer disappears. Fixes issue #212.

Version 1.51
============
New features:
- When playing for the first time in endless, 4 coins are granted for free to help get things going.

Bug fixes:
- If a stage in endless mode cannot be loaded, a new stage layout is generated.
- Chips created by von Neumann with level 2 or higher now have the correct value. When selling these chips, the refund is halved.
- Heroes that are active are always visible now, even if their prerequisites are no longer met.
- The number of available coins were not saved if a stage was not finished.
- Chips with level 0 are removed at the beginning of a stage.

Miscellaneous:
- The additional chips created by the game (both helpful and unwanted) are recreated every time the level is played.
- Turing's biography now mentions that the Enigma was initially broken by the Polish Cipher Bureau.

Version 1.50
============
New features:
- Link to Wikipedia articles added for heroes and heroines

Bug fixes:
- Fixed a bug when changing between apps in the hero screen

Version 1.49
============
New features:
- New hero: John von Neumann
- Some more did you know text

Bug fixes:
- Attackers stored in MEM or ACC sometimes remained visible on the screen.
- The text on the chips is scaled down if it does not fit into the rectangle.

Miscellaneous:
- Small changes in the hero dependency tree. For the current tree, see the game's wiki.
- Ameliorations to the Level Select and the Info screen
- Reduced cost of resistor chips

Version 1.48
============
Bug fixes:
- No reward coins were awarded in Endless series after a game reset.

Miscellaneous:
- Heroes are no longer automatically available in TURBO and ENDLESS. The hero tree applies for all series.

Version 1.47
============
New features:
- Endless series can be reset independently from the basic series.

Bug fixes:
- Background image no longer changes when switching between apps.
- Attackers held in MEM chips kept this state even after being released.

Version 1.46
============
New features:
- added a special Christmas level
- The game's language can be changed via the device Settings dialogue.

Bug fixes:
- added a safety catch for trapped attackers
- corrected a migration problem

Version 1.45
============
New features:
- The mission briefing text is now scrollable. This should avoid the text overlapping if it doesn't fit on the screen.

Bug fixes:
- Corrected portrait image for John Conway

Version 1.44
============
New features:
- New hero: John Conway
- Some more Did you know texts.

Bug fixes:
- Some fixes to the purchase lives dialogue

Miscellaneous:
- Major re-organisation of save files. This should result in faster loading, and generally
 less laggy behaviour of the app.

Version 1.43
============
New features:
- In “endless” mode, lost lives can be recovered for coins by tapping on the CPU.

Bug fixes:
- Some text size and other layout corrections
- The “quit level” dialogue now freezes the game.

Version 1.42
============
New features:
- Stage number is displayed on the game screen

Bug fixes:
- Fixed some problems when selecting heroes for leave
- Fixed heat to cash conversion calculation for resistors

Miscellaneous:
- The required shortest path length in endless mode has been raised for stage numbers > 200

Version 1.41
============
Bug fixes:
- Fixed some problems when returning after switching apps
- Better loading and scaling of background images
- Margaret Hamilton must not appear before stage 24.
- Some text corrections

Miscellaneous:
- Massively reduced the number of waves for higher stages in Endless mode
- Resistors now act simultaneously on all targets in range.
- Slightly changed the screen size of several game element

Version 1.40
============
New features:
- New heroes: Claude Shannon, George Boole, Whit Diffie
- Resistors now produce heat, which can be converted into information if Shannon is available.
- Some more Did you know messages.

Bug fixes:
- Avoid a situation where the player must choose a hero, but none is displayed.
- Heroes always went on leave for three levels, regardless of what the text said.
- The game uses a default system font if the desired font is not available. This had led to crashes on some devices.

Version 1.39
============
New features:
- Starting with endless stage 16, heroes may go on holiday. The player must choose one of several proposed heroes and grant leave to one of them.

Bug fixes:
- Attackers that were slowed down by resistors behaved weird in ACC and MEM chips.

Miscellaneous:
- The slowing effect of resistors now depend on the attackers' value. The stronger the attacker, the more it gets slowed.

Version 1.38
============
New features:
- The attackers held in the internal register of MEM and ACC are now released when selling the chip.

Bug fixes:
- Game elements as well as hired heroes became active only when the stage was played a second time.
- MEM and ACC chips are no longer emptied when resuming the app.

Miscellaneous:
- Removed the SELL option in stage 6

Version 1.37
============
Bug fixes:
- Fixed some bugs that occurred when re-entering the application.

Miscellaneous:
- Use of a custom font for chips and code fragments.

Version 1.36
============
New functions:
- New chip type: Resistors
- Level 32 added
- New heroes: Georg Ohm, Alessandro Volta

Bug fixes:
- The level indicator on the welcome screen was limited to 99.

Version 1.35
============
Bug fixes:
- Fixed an occasional game crash when there were lots of attackers.
- Leibniz is no longer affected by Sid Meier.
- MEM chips are no longer sold instantly.

Version 1.34
============
IMPORTANT: The Endless level series now has its own CryptoCoins and a separate set of heroes. The existing coins have been distributed proportionally. Under certain circumstances, the heroes had to be reset; in this case, the coins have been credited to you and you will have to hire the heroes again.
The difficulty of the Endless levels has been drastically reduced in compensation.

New functions:
- New hero: Gottfried Leibniz.

Bug fixes:
- There were no CryptoCoins for level 30.
- ACC chips showed more than one slot, although they can only hold one value.

Miscellaneous:
- Tramiel is limited to level 5 now.
- Upgrade of MEM chips is significantly more expensive and requires Leibniz.

Version 1.33
============
 Two more levels were added, introducing SPLT and DUP.
 Heroes now can be downgraded individually.
 MEM chips can be upgraded (up to level 4) to hold more than one value. An explanatory text was added to stage 14.

Miscellaneous:
 Chips now target cryptocoins first.

Version 1.32
============
New Features:
 New hero added: Margaret Hamilton

Bugfixes:
 Level selection in endless series was limited.
 Two MEM chips could swallow the same attacker simultaneously.

Version 1.31
============
New Features:
 Two more types of negative chips: DUP and SPLT
 (an introductory level with explanation will be added later).

Bugfixes:
 Number of negative chips in endless stages reduced.
 Revised the calculation of stage difficulty in endless stages.
 Isolated slots are avoided, paths have a minimum length.

Miscellaneous:
 Removal cost of negative chips depend on how many have already been removed.

Version 1.30
============
New Features:
- new hero: Claude Chappe
- Clearer design for buying and selling chips
- Chips now choose their target intelligently (with more than one attacker in range)
- Added an easter egg.

Bugfixes:
- No new endless stages were available in the level selector beyond level 28.
- Heat generation and damage corrected and adjusted
- Fixed yet another bug when resuming the game

Miscellaneous:
- Changes in endless stage generation. Difficulty of the stage layout increases with the level. Impossible configurations are avoided.
- Changed the order of some levels in normal mode to make the difficulty progress more consistently.

Version 1.29
============
New Features:
- New design for welcome screen. Moved start new game to settings. Added Release Notes in info section.
- Revised generation of levels in endless series and made these levels clearer. Multiple CPUs are now possible.

Bugfixes:
- Attackers were accelerated too much in ACC chips
- Correction of speed control button size
- Scrolling hero list was too slow

Miscellaneous:
- IMPORTANT: MEM chips must now be cleared by hand (by tapping on them) before they can absorb next attackers.

Version 1.28
============
New Features:
- New endless level series
- In the About screen, added links for accessing the game wiki and the license on the Internet.
- Chips are not removed instantly after being sold. Instead, they complete their current cooldown.

Bugfixes:
- The game crashed when trying to display kiB values

Miscellaneous:
- decreased overall attacker frequency
- slightly increased Mandelbrot´s effect
- Attackers now have their speed slightly altered by ACC chips
- several adjustments to game play

Version 1.27
============
New Features:
- Chips can be bought and sold even when game is paused.
- Introduction of heat. Overheating may result in loss of one life.
- Temperature sensor added to score board.
- New chip type: NOP
- New hero: Jack Kilby

Bugfixes:
- Passing coins do no longer activate MEM chips.
- Chip type is shown on description of range-extending heroes.
- Text on Hire button did not change on purchase or reset.
- Score board layout improved.

Miscellaneous:
- Re-organization of preferences / saved games file
- Changed the way how game speed is handled

Version 1.26
============
New Features:
- new settings and about dialog
- hero biography is now scrollable
- added button to lock scrolling of the game viewport

Bugfixes:
- fixed a bug that led to loss of heroes in version 1.25.
 Added correction code to refund coins lost due to this bug.
- chip sell prices were not converted to B or kiB
- SHR 9 (and higher) chips had no effect
- attackers stopped appearing when pausing the game between two waves
- corrected delay between waves in fast forward mode

Miscellaneous:
- stage 8 made easier
- LEDs now go out instead of turning red

Version 1.25
============
New Features:
- Chips can be bought and sold even when game is paused.
- Introduction of heat. Overheating may result in loss of one life.
- Temperature sensor added to score board.
- New chip type: NOP
- New hero: Jack Kilby

Bugfixes:
- Passing coins do no longer activate MEM chips.
- Chip type is shown on description of range-extending heroes.
- Text on Hire button did not change on purchase or reset.
- Score board layout improved.

Miscellaneous:
- Re-organization of preferences / saved games file
- Changed the way how game speed is handled


Version 1.24
============
New Features:
- new background pictures
- hero costs are shown on the ´hire´ button
- overall small graphical improvements

Bugfixes:
- game stays in portrait mode, keeps the device awake
- corrected coin count and size of attackers when resuming game

Miscellaneous:
- replaced Android system style dialogs by custom design

Version 1.22
============
New Features:
- Chips can be bought and sold even when game is paused.
- Introduction of heat. Overheating may result in loss of one life.
- Temperature sensor added to score board.
- New chip type: NOP
- New hero: Jack Kilby

Bugfixes:
- Passing coins do no longer activate MEM chips.
- Chip type is shown on description of range-extending heroes.
- Text on Hire button did not change on purchase or reset.
- Score board layout improved.

Miscellaneous:
- Re-organization of preferences / saved games file
- Changed the way how game speed is handled</string>
<string name="instr_leave">Some heroes are asking for time off. You must grant leave to one of them, who will return after %d levels.</string>
<string name="instr_leave_1">Some heroes are asking for time off. You must grant leave to one of them, who will return in the next level.</string>

<string name="shannon">Claude Elwood Shannon is considered the founder of information theory and one of the fathers of the information age. One of his major achievements was to transfer the mathematical theory of Boolean algebra to real circuits, thereby making modern digital computers possible. \n\nShannon developed the concept of information and entropy in messages, made important contributions to cryptography, and worked on artificial intelligence. Among other things, he described a programme for playing chess and constructed a mechanical mouse that could find its own way through a maze. </string>

<string name="boole">The achievement of George Boole Jr. lies in the fact that he formalised the concepts of logic and thus made them part of mathematics. Boolean algebra is the basis for the internal functioning of all modern computers.\n\nBoole was the son of a shoemaker and never attended any school other than primary school. He taught himself maths, Latin and Greek, French and German.</string>

<string name="diffie">Together with Martin Hellmann, Bailey Whitfield Diffie developed the DH key exchange between two parties named after the two of them. They thus created an essential prerequisite for secure connections over the Internet.\n\nDiffie is also concerned about social issues of cryptography. He is a staunch advocate of the right to privacy.</string>

<string name="conway">John Horton Conway is best known for the invention of Conway\'s Game Of Life, a cellular automaton that generates complex living patterns on a computer screen. He was interested in mathematical games, with and without computers, and published one of the first algorithms to solve Rubik\'s cube. However, he also made a lot of contributions to “serious” mathematics.</string>
<string name="query_purchase_life">Do you want to spend %s to recover a life?</string>
<string name="annotation_purchase_life">This dialog can be disabled in “Settings”. You will still be able to purchase lives by tapping on the CPU.</string>
<string name="settings_language_selection_text">To change the game\'s language, use the system “Settings” of your device and go to “App Languages”.</string>

<string name="neumann">"All modern computers have an internal von Neumann architecture. This way of combining memory, arithmetic unit and program control to create a freely programmable machine was largely developed by John von Neumann, who is considered one of the fathers of computer science. He was a brilliant mathematician who, among other things, laid the mathematical foundations of quantum mechanics, but also decisively advanced game theory. He was also a highly intelligent and witty person and a real party animal.\n\nThe darker side of von Neumann´s life is his contributions to military research and the development and use of weapons of mass destruction."</string>

<item>To subtract one number from another in the binary system, you don\'t need to know how to subtract. Instead, you invert the number, add 1 and add the result.\n\nWhy does this work? If you invert a number - for example 0101 1110 (x5E) into 1010 0001 (xA1) - and add the two together, you always get 1111 1111 (i.e. xFF). Add 1 and discard the carry, this will yield 0000 0000. You can therefore interpret the number xA2 (i.e. xA1 plus 1) as “minus x5E”. Example: x7F - x5E is x21, and x7F + xA2 (shortened to 8 bits) is also x21.</item>
